briefdescription.para: Some useful typedefs.
Constructs an empty MultiFab. Data can be defined at a later time using the define member functions inherited from FabArray.

memberdef.argsstring: (const BoxArray &bs, const DistributionMapping &dm, int ncomp, int ngrow, const MFInfo &info=MFInfo(), const FabFactory< FArrayBox > &factory=FArrayBoxFactory())
memberdef.name: MultiFab

briefdescription.para: Constructs a MultiFab.

detaileddescription.para:
bs
a valid region
dm
a DistribuionMapping
ncomp
number of components
ngrow
number of cells the region grows
info
MFInfo
The size of the FArrayBox is given by the Box grown by ngrow and the number of components is given by ncomp. If info is set to not allocateing memroy, then no FArrayBoxes are allocated at this time but can be defined later.

memberdef.argsstring: (const BoxArray &bs, const DistributionMapping &dm, int ncomp, const IntVect &ngrow, const MFInfo &info=MFInfo(), const FabFactory< FArrayBox > &factory=FArrayBoxFactory())
memberdef.name: MultiFab

memberdef.name: MultiFab

briefdescription.para: Make an alias MultiFab. maketype must be amrex::make_alias. scomp is the starting component of the alias and ncomp is the number of components in the new aliasing MultiFab.

briefdescription.para: Initialize FArrayBoxes.

memberdef.argsstring: (int comp, int nghost=0, bool local=false) const
memberdef.name: min

briefdescription.para: Returns the minimum value contained in component comp of the MultiFab. The parameter nghost determines the number of boundary cells to search for the minimum. The default is to search only the valid regions of the FArrayBoxes.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Box &b, int comp, int nghost=0, bool local=false) const
memberdef.name: min

briefdescription.para: Identical to min() function, but confines its search to intersection of Box b and the MultiFab.

memberdef.argsstring: (int comp, int nghost=0, bool local=false) const
memberdef.name: max

briefdescription.para: Returns the maximum value contained in component comp of the MultiFab. The parameter nghost determines the number of boundary cells to search for the maximum. The default is to search only the valid regions of the FArrayBoxes.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Box &b, int comp, int nghost=0, bool local=false) const
memberdef.name: max

briefdescription.para: Identical to the previous max() function, but confines its search to intersection of Box b and the MultiFab.

memberdef.argsstring: (int comp=0, int nghost=0, bool local=false) const
memberdef.name: norm0

briefdescription.para: Returns the maximum absolute value contained in component comp of the MultiFab.

memberdef.name: norm0

memberdef.name: norm0

briefdescription.para: Returns the maximum absolute values contained in each component of "comps" of the MultiFab. No ghost cells are used.

memberdef.argsstring: (int comp, const Periodicity &period) const
memberdef.name: norm1

briefdescription.para: Returns the L1 norm of component "comp" over the MultiFab. No ghost cells are used. This version has no double counting for nodal data.

memberdef.argsstring: (int comp=0, int ngrow=0, bool local=false) const
memberdef.name: norm1

briefdescription.para: Returns the L1 norm of component "comp" over the MultiFab. ngrow ghost cells are used.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Vector< int > &comps, int ngrow=0, bool local=false) const
memberdef.name: norm1

briefdescription.para: Returns the L1 norm of each component of "comps" over the MultiFab. ngrow ghost cells are used.

memberdef.argsstring: (int comp=0) const
memberdef.name: norm2

briefdescription.para: Returns the L2 norm of component "comp" over the MultiFab. No ghost cells are used.

memberdef.argsstring: (int comp, const Periodicity &period) const
memberdef.name: norm2

briefdescription.para: Returns the L2 norm of component "comp" over the MultiFab. No ghost cells are used. This version has no double counting for nodal data.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Vector< int > &comps) const
memberdef.name: norm2

briefdescription.para: Returns the L2 norm of each component of "comps" over the MultiFab. No ghost cells are used.

memberdef.argsstring: (int comp=0, bool local=false) const
memberdef.name: sum

briefdescription.para: Returns the sum of component "comp" over the MultiFab no ghost cells are included.

memberdef.argsstring: (Real val, int comp, int num_comp, int nghost=0)
memberdef.name: plus

briefdescription.para: Adds the scalar value val to the value of each cell in the specified subregion of the MultiFab. The subregion consists of the num_comp components starting at component comp. The value of nghost specifies the number of cells in the boundary region of each FArrayBox in the subregion that should be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (Real val, const Box &region, int comp, int num_comp, int nghost=0)
memberdef.name: plus

briefdescription.para: Identical to the previous version of plus(), with the restriction that the subregion is further constrained to the intersection with Box region.

memberdef.argsstring: (Real val, int nghost)
memberdef.name: plus

briefdescription.para: Adds the scalar value val to the value of each cell in the valid region of each component of the MultiFab. The value of nghost specifies the number of cells in the boundary region that should be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (Real val, const Box &region, int nghost)
memberdef.name: plus

briefdescription.para: Adds the scalar value val to the value of each cell in the valid region of each component of the MultiFab, that also intersects the Box region. The value of nghost specifies the number of cells in the boundary region of each FArrayBox in the subregion that should be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (Real val, int comp, int num_comp, int nghost=0)
memberdef.name: mult

briefdescription.para: Scales the value of each cell in the specified subregion of the MultiFab by the scalar val (a[i] <- a[i]*val). The subregion consists of the num_comp components starting at component comp. The value of nghost specifies the number of cells in the boundary region of each FArrayBox in the subregion that should be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (Real val, const Box &region, int comp, int num_comp, int nghost=0)
memberdef.name: mult

briefdescription.para: Identical to the previous version of mult(), with the restriction that the subregion is further constrained to the intersection with Box region. The value of nghost specifies the number of cells in the boundary region of each FArrayBox in the subregion that should be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (Real val, int nghost=0)
memberdef.name: mult

briefdescription.para: Scales the value of each cell in the valid region of each component of the MultiFab by the scalar val (a[i] <- a[i]*val). The value of nghost specifies the number of cells in the boundary region that should be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (Real val, const Box &region, int nghost=0)
memberdef.name: mult

briefdescription.para: Scales the value of each cell in the valid region of each component of the MultiFab by the scalar val (a[i] <- a[i]*val), that also intersects the Box region. The value of nghost specifies the number of cells in the boundary region of each FArrayBox in the subregion that should be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (Real numerator, int comp, int num_comp, int nghost=0)
memberdef.name: invert

briefdescription.para: Replaces the value of each cell in the specified subregion of the MultiFab with its reciprocal multiplied by the value of numerator. The subregion consists of the num_comp components starting at component comp. The value of nghost specifies the number of cells in the boundary region of each FArrayBox in the subregion that should be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (Real numerator, const Box &region, int comp, int num_comp, int nghost=0)
memberdef.name: invert

briefdescription.para: Identical to the previous version of invert(), with the restriction that the subregion is further constrained to the intersection with Box region. The value of nghost specifies the number of cells in the boundary region of each FArrayBox in the subregion that should be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (Real numerator, int nghost)
memberdef.name: invert

briefdescription.para: Replaces the value of each cell in the specified subregion of the MultiFab with its reciprocal multiplied by the value of numerator. The value of nghost specifies the number of cells in the boundary region that should be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (Real numerator, const Box &region, int nghost)
memberdef.name: invert

briefdescription.para: Replaces the value of each cell in the specified subregion of the MultiFab, that also intersects the Box region, with its reciprocal multiplied by the value of numerator. The value of nghost specifies the number of cells in the boundary region of each FArrayBox in the subregion that should be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (int comp, int num_comp, int nghost=0)
memberdef.name: negate

briefdescription.para: Negates the value of each cell in the specified subregion of the MultiFab. The subregion consists of the num_comp components starting at component comp. The value of nghost specifies the number of cells in the boundary region of each FArrayBox in the subregion that should be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Box &region, int comp, int num_comp, int nghost=0)
memberdef.name: negate

briefdescription.para: Identical to the previous version of negate(), with the restriction that the subregion is further constrained to the intersection with Box region.

memberdef.argsstring: (int nghost=0)
memberdef.name: negate

briefdescription.para: Negates the value of each cell in the valid region of the MultiFab. The value of nghost specifies the number of cells in the boundary region that should be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Box &region, int nghost=0)
memberdef.name: negate

briefdescription.para: Negates the value of each cell in the valid region of the MultiFab that also intersects the Box region. The value of nghost specifies the number of cells in the boundary region that should be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (int comp, int nghost=0) const
memberdef.name: minIndex

memberdef.argsstring: (int comp, int nghost=0) const
memberdef.name: maxIndex

memberdef.argsstring: (const MultiFab &mf, int strt_comp, int num_comp, int nghost)
memberdef.name: plus

briefdescription.para: This function adds the values of the cells in mf to the corresponding cells of this MultiFab. mf is required to have the same BoxArray or "valid region" as this MultiFab. The addition is done only to num_comp components, starting with component number strt_comp. The parameter nghost specifies the number of boundary cells that will be modified. If nghost == 0, only the valid region of each FArrayBox will be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (const MultiFab &mf, int strt_comp, int num_comp, int nghost)
memberdef.name: minus

briefdescription.para: This function subtracts the values of the cells in mf from the corresponding cells of this MultiFab. mf is required to have the same BoxArray or "valid region" as this MultiFab. The subtraction is done only to num_comp components, starting with component number strt_comp. The parameter nghost specifies the number of boundary cells that will be modified. If nghost == 0, only the valid region of each FArrayBox will be modified.

memberdef.argsstring: (const MultiFab &mf, int strt_comp, int num_comp, int nghost)
memberdef.name: divide

briefdescription.para: This function divides the values of the cells in mf from the corresponding cells of this MultiFab. mf is required to have the same BoxArray or "valid region" as this MultiFab. The division is done only to num_comp components, starting with component number strt_comp. The parameter nghost specifies the number of boundary cells that will be modified. If nghost == 0, only the valid region of each FArrayBox will be modified. Note, nothing is done to protect against divide by zero.

memberdef.argsstring: (bool local=false) const
memberdef.name: contains_nan

briefdescription.para: Are there any NaNs in the MF? This may return false, even if the MF contains NaNs, if the machine doesn't support the appropriate NaN testing functions.

detaileddescription.para: This version checks all components and grow cells.

memberdef.argsstring: (int scomp, int ncomp, int ngrow=0, bool local=false) const

memberdef.argsstring: (bool local=false) const
memberdef.name: contains_inf

briefdescription.para: Are there any Infs in the MF? This may return false, even if the MF contains Infs, if the machine doesn't support the appropriate Inf testing functions. This version checks all components and grow cells.

briefdescription.para: dst += src1*src2

A collection (stored as an array) of FArrayBox objects. This class is useful for storing floating point data on a domain defined by a union of rectangular regions embedded in a uniform index space. MultiFab class extends the function of the underlying FabArray class just as the FArrayBox class extends the funtion of BaseFab<Real>. Additional member functions are defined for I/O and simple arithmetic operations on these aggregate objects. This class does NOT provide a copy constructor or assignment operator.
